title: fix integration with schedulemaker
body:
https://github.com/briangathright/comp-schedulemaker

Right now, the output of the schedulemaker script has to be manually copied into this repo. This is tedious and error-prone. 

Instead, it will probably be best to handle the generated schedule completely outside this Sphinx site by, say, linking there directly from T4.

title: update encrypted credentials for Travis script
body:
remote: Invalid username or password.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://[secure]@github.com/LoyolaChicagoCS/coursedescriptions.git/'
The command "GH_USER=LoyolaChicagoCS GH_REPO=coursedescriptions "./gh-pages.sh"" exited with 128.

title: Fix warnings with duplicate PDF target (in our syllabus script)
body:
@jweezy24 For our syllabi, we need to generate a *unique* link target name for each of the Google Drive hyperlinks. At present, we have a link named PDF.  Ideally, it would be <instrutor>-<course>-<section>[-<seq>], where a <seq> would only be added to ensure the name is unique.

When you run the Sphinx build, here is what we see happening:

```
/Volumes/Work/coursedescriptions/source/syllabi/spring_2019_syllabi2.rst:4: WARNING: Duplicate explicit target name: "pdf".
/Volumes/Work/coursedescriptions/source/syllabi/spring_2019_syllabi2.rst:4: WARNING: Duplicate explicit target name: "pdf".
/Volumes/Work/coursedescriptions/source/syllabi/spring_2019_syllabi2.rst:4: WARNING: Duplicate explicit target name: "pdf".
```

title: Add link to main page for reporting issues
Add Description and Outcome to source/courses/comp266.rst
body: There is no description or outcome text for the course listing of COMP 266.

title: Merge LoyolaChicagoCS/gradhandbook into this repository
body:
The content of LoyolaChicagoCS/gradhandbook needs to be merged in its entirety into a grad-info folder of this repository.

It is recommended to just drag and drop the content of the LoyolaChicagoCS/gradhandbook repository into this one.

body: See title

title: Spell and Grammar Check documents
body: Ensure that the content that is posted is grammatically correct

title: Update Content
body:
Fill out the requested content:

1. What content do you want to update on the site?

The listed current and past syllabi

2. What is the URL of where you want to update content?

https://academics.cs.luc.edu/syllabi/syllabi.html
https://academics.cs.luc.edu/syllabi/legacy-syllabi.html

3. Why should content be updated?

The content listed here is out of date and does not reflect the Fall 2021 semester.

If need be, only keep the Spring 2021 syllabi and nothing else on https://academics.cs.luc.edu/syllabi/syllabi.html

title: Add Content
body:

Add page header information about the availible Undergraduate programs offered here at LUC

2. What is the URL of where you want to update content?

https://academics.cs.luc.edu/undergraduate/undergraduate-degree-programs.html

3. Why should content be updated?

In order to be consistent with the Graduate Degree Programs page (https://academics.cs.luc.edu/graduate/graduate-degree-programs.html) and to provide more information to incoming and current Undergraduate students

title: Fix mscs.rst
body:
Fill out the requested content:

1. What content do you want to update on the site?

The table [here](https://academics.cs.luc.edu/graduate/mscs.html#computer-systems-concentration-12-credits) is malformed and is improperly implemented in the `rst` file.

Use a csv-table directive to implement the table as it is both prettier, and reduces code/ file complexity.

2. What is the URL of where you want to update content?

https://academics.cs.luc.edu/graduate/mscs.html#computer-systems-concentration-12-credits

3. Why should content be updated?

The table is malformed and runs off of the page.

The current table implementation in the rst file hard codes the table in. What should be done is utilize the csv-table directive in order to make the table reusable and reproducable elsewhere on the website.
